website_summaries.verdict: This variation of the classic Puma GV Special offers a fresh look for the silhouette. The Puma GV Special Basic Sport features a new set of colorways yet offers the same quality performance as of its origins. This low-top sneaker offers superior comfort and style with a price that leaves the wallet happy, making it a great deal.
pros: A lot of the reviewers were satisfied with how comfortable the Puma GV Special Basic Sport feels on foot
A couple of buyers said that the shoe is great for those who have foot or ankle problems
Several were glad about how the shoe can match with different attires
Many buyers gave praises on the stylish look of the sneaker
A buyer can choose among the various colorways offered for the shoe
One can get a pair of the Puma GV Special Basic sport at a budget-friendly price
cons: Several reviewers advised on going at least half a size larger when purchasing the Puma GV Special Basic Sport as it may run small
The shoe may need some break-in time, according to a few buyers
Some users pointed out that the shoe feels a little narrow on foot

customer_reviews.title: A little on the narrow side, but in truth, real tennis shoes are designed for lateral support, so....
customer_reviews.text: I love the style. I remember my dad wearing these on the tennis court in the 1980's. Not totally sure they are authentic Puma, but close enough. I enjoy them. A little on the narrow side, but in truth, real tennis shoes are designed for lateral support, so they tend to be a bit more snug in width than a more relaxed sneaker. No complaints here. Excellent price for a classic/retro tennis shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jasper Johns

customer_reviews.title: Cool looking and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Once I broke these shoes in, I felt that they were quite comfortable and, also, look even better in person. I'm very happy with the purchase. They do run a little small and a little narrow, but I knew this going in and purchased the correct size.
customer_reviews.author: Ace Freely

customer_reviews.title: These shoes have poor quality leather
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have poor quality leather, with all synthetic materials on the inside. My feet get hot in these shoes, and after 2 months of casual wearing, they smell permanently. Now even after just putting them on for 30 min, the smell rubs off on my fresh socks.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for $35
customer_reviews.text: The price was good, $35 I believe, but I was a little surprised by the build quality. The tongue was very thin (my first puma's) and I cannot comment if that is a retro thing or a cheap thing. The body of the shoe appears solid and I believe the glue etc., will hold and give me a couple years of light tennis activity. Once I return to a more streneous level of play I will surely need to upgrade, but again I got these for under $40 so no complaints. If I paid closer to $70 the review might be different. Good look, and I'll look ready for prime-time with the matching Men's Cat Patch Fit Cap, lol.
